creator: Bain & Company
description: A framework for understanding the 30 fundamental elements that drive customer value and loyalty
core_concept: Value is in the eye of the beholder - different customers value different elements

functional_elements.description: Practical benefits that help customers get things done

elements.name: Saves Time
elements.definition: Reduces the time required to complete tasks
elements.revenue_impact: High - customers pay premium for time savings

elements.name: Simplifies
elements.definition: Makes complex tasks easier to understand and execute
elements.revenue_impact: High - reduces customer effort and increases adoption
elements.pricing_potential: Premium pricing for ease of use

elements.name: Reduces Cost
elements.definition: Lowers the total cost of ownership or operation

elements.name: Reduces Risk
elements.definition: Minimizes potential negative outcomes or losses
elements.revenue_impact: High - customers pay for peace of mind

elements.name: Organizes
elements.definition: Helps customers structure and manage information or processes

elements.name: Integrates
elements.definition: Connects with other systems or processes

elements.name: Connects
elements.definition: Brings people together or facilitates relationships

elements.name: Reduces Effort
elements.definition: Minimizes the physical or mental work required

elements.name: Avoids Hassles
elements.definition: Eliminates annoying or time-consuming problems

elements.name: Makes Money
elements.definition: Helps customers generate revenue or profit

elements.name: Reduces Anxiety
elements.definition: Decreases worry, stress, or uncertainty
elements.pricing_potential: Premium pricing for peace of mind

elements.name: Rewards Me
elements.definition: Provides incentives, recognition, or benefits

emotional_elements.description: Psychological benefits that make customers feel good

elements.name: Fun/Entertainment
elements.definition: Provides enjoyment, amusement, or pleasure

elements.name: Attractive Appearance
elements.definition: Makes customers look or feel more attractive

elements.name: Provides Access
elements.definition: Gives access to exclusive or limited resources

elements.name: Variety
elements.definition: Offers multiple options or choices

elements.name: Therapeutic Value
elements.definition: Provides healing, comfort, or emotional support

elements.name: Nostalgia
elements.definition: Evokes positive memories or feelings from the past

elements.name: Design/Aesthetics
elements.definition: Provides visual appeal or artistic value

elements.name: Badge Value
elements.definition: Provides status, prestige, or social recognition

elements.name: Wellness
elements.definition: Improves physical or mental health

life_changing_elements.description: Transformational benefits that help customers become better versions of themselves

elements.name: Self-Actualization
elements.definition: Helps customers reach their full potential

elements.name: Motivation
elements.definition: Inspires customers to take action or achieve goals

elements.name: Heirloom
elements.definition: Creates lasting value that can be passed down

elements.name: Affiliation/Belonging
elements.definition: Creates sense of community or belonging

identification_process: Search through all content for explicit mentions
Look for implied value elements through language
Score each element 0-100 based on evidence strength
